base64.description: Convert between Base64 and other formats

decode.description: Convert Base64 encoded data back to its original format.

steps.convert: Select 'Decode' mode to convert back to original format
steps.input: Paste Base64 encoded text in the input area
steps.result: View or download the decoded result
steps.title: Decoding Steps
steps.verify: Ensure the input is valid Base64 (should only contain A-Z, a-z, 0-9, +, /, =)

decode.title: Decoding from Base64

encode.description: Convert text or files into Base64 format for safe data transmission.

steps.convert: Your input will be automatically converted to Base64
steps.copy: Copy the encoded result using the copy button
steps.input: Enter text or upload a file in the input area
steps.select: Select 'Encode' mode if not already selected
steps.title: Encoding Steps

encode.title: Encoding to Base64

list.file_support: Support for text and file conversion
list.title: Available Features

list.file_size: Be mindful of file sizes as Base64 increases size by ~33%
list.special_chars: Watch for special characters and line breaks
list.title: Usage Tips
list.verify_input: Always verify your Base64 input for correct formatting

tips.note: Note: Base64 encoding is commonly used for transmitting binary data over text-based systems. It's not a form of encryption and doesn't provide security.
tips.title: Tips & Best Practices

converters.description: Tools for converting data between different formats

tooltip.preview: The preview styling may differ from your website's styling as it uses a default GitHub-like theme. The HTML output can be styled according to your needs.

basic.title: Basic Usage
basic.description: Convert your Markdown content to clean, well-formatted HTML.

steps.title: Basic Steps
steps.input: Enter your Markdown text in the input field
steps.convert: Click 'Convert to HTML' to transform your content
steps.preview: Check the preview to see how your content will look
steps.copy: Copy the generated HTML code for your use

syntax.title: Markdown Syntax
syntax.description: Common Markdown syntax elements supported by the converter.

elements.title: Basic Elements
elements.headings: Headings: Use # for h1, ## for h2, etc.
elements.lists: Lists: Use - or * for bullets, 1. for numbered lists

tips.title: Tips & Best Practices

list.title: Usage Tips
list.preview_first: Always preview your content before using the HTML
list.syntax_check: Double-check your Markdown syntax if the output looks wrong
list.use_sample: Use the sample content to learn Markdown syntax
list.styling: Remember that the preview styling is just a reference

tips.note: Note: The converter uses GitHub Flavored Markdown syntax and includes support for tables, task lists, and syntax highlighting.
